authorizationPermissions.description: Permissions the authenticated user has over this payment regarding authorizations.

authorizations.description: Contains the details of the authorizations this payment has (for the previous levels). To see the final status of the payment please check the `authorizationStatus` property.

transfer.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `payment`. This is the transfer generated when the payment was processed. Will be null if the went through authorization and was not authorized. Only returned if this `TransactionView` is not already in a `TransactionView`.

scheduledPaymentPermissions.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `scheduledPayment`. Permissions over the scheduled payment.

dueAmount.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `scheduledPayment`. Means the amount that is still needs to be paid until the last installment.

installments.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `scheduledPayment`. Contains the installment references.

recurringPaymentPermissions.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `recurringPayment`. Permissions over the scheduled payment.

nextOccurrenceDate.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `recurringPayment`. The scheduled date for the next occurrence.

occurrenceInterval.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `recurringPayment`. The interval between occurrences.

occurrencesCount.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `recurringPayment`. The programmed number of occurrences. If not set, means the payment will be processed until manually canceled.

occurrences.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `recurringPayment`. A list with all occurrences this payment has.

originalTransfer.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `chargeback`. This is the original transfer that has been charged back.

chargebackTransfer.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `chargeback`. This is the transfer which performed the chargeback.

paymentRequestPermissions.description: Permissions the user has over this payment request.

comments.description: Only returned if the `kind` is either `paymentRequest` or `externalPayment`. The comments the user informed when performing the payment.

expirationDate.description: Only returned if the `kind` is either `paymentRequest`, `externalPayment` or `ticket`. The deadline for the payment to be processed.  In case of `externalPayment` if no user is registered with either e-mail or mobile phone matching, it is canceled. The same is done in case of `ticket` if it is not accepted by any user.

changeExpirationDateComments.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `paymentRequest`. The comments the user informed when changing the expiration date.

processDate.description: Only returned if the `kind` is either `paymentRequest`, `ticket` or `externalPayment` and `status` is `processed`. The date the payment request / ticket was accepted.

transaction.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `paymentRequest`, `ticket` or `externalPayment`  and `status` is `processed`. Reference to the transaction that was generated when processing this payment request / externalPayment / ticket.

smsCode.description: Only returned if the `kind` is either `paymentRequest` and `status` is not `processed`. The code that can be used by the receiver to confirm this payment request via SMS operation.

scheduled.description:
See the documentation of `scheduling` instead.


Only returned if the `kind` is `paymentRequest`. Indicates whether a scheduled payment (`true`)  will be generated once this payment request is confirmed.

scheduling.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `paymentRequest`. Indicates whether the generated payment will be a scheduled, recurring or regular payment once this payment request is confirmed.

installmentsCount.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `paymentRequest` and `scheduled` is `true`. Indicates the number of installments to be generated.

firstInstallmentIsImmediate.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `paymentRequest` and `scheduled` is `true`. Indicates whether the first installment should be processed immediately when the payment request is confirmed.

firstOccurrenceIsImmediate.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `paymentRequest` and `scheduling` is `recurring`. Indicates whether the first occurrence should be processed immediately when the payment request is confirmed.

toPrincipalType.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `externalPayment`. Is the user identification method for this external payment (for example, e-mail or mobile phone).

toPrincipalValue.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `externalPayment`. Is the user identification value for this external payment (for example, the e-mail or mobile phone values).

payerPrincipal.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `ticket`, the ticket status is `open` and there is a fixed payer. Is the principal (for example, login name or e-mail) which can be used to login the user, so he can accept the ticket.

cancelUrl.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `ticket`. The URL to redirect when canceling the ticket.

successUrl.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `ticket`. The URL to redirect after successfully accepting a ticket

preview.description: Only returned if the `kind` is `ticket` and the ticket can be accepted. Is the payment preview if accepting the ticket. The preview will never contain a confirmation password input, because this object already contains it on the `confirmationPasswordInput` property, neither a payment to be sent back, as this payment is supposed to be confirmed by accepting the ticket. Also, the preview's currency is never sent, as it is the same one of the ticket.

Transfer.description: Reference to a balance transfer between accounts

display.description: The descriptive text for this transfer, according to the transfer type and currency configuration in Cyclos

amount.description: The transfer amount. May be positive or negative.

from.description: The account that sent the balance

to.description: The account that received the balance

transactionNumber.description: The transaction number identifying this balance transfer. The currency configuration has the definition on whether transaction numbers are enabled and which format they have.

statuses.description: Contains the current status for each status flow this transfer has

TransferDataForSearch.description: Contains data for searching transfers over multiple accounts

query.description: Default query filters for the general transfers search

TransferFeePreview.description: Preview of a transfer fee in case a payment is confirmed

currency.description: Either id or internal name of the currency

fromAccountType.description: Either id or internal name of the origin account type

toAccountType.description: Either id or internal name of the destination account type

TransferStatus.description: Reference to a status and its flow

TransferStatusFlow.description: A transfer status flow determines a status a transfer may have. For each flow the transfer participates (can be multiple) the transfer will have a status. The transition between states is also defined on the flow.

TransferStatusFlowForTransferView.description: Contains other data for a transfer status flow when viewing a transfer.

canManage.description: Can this status flow be managed by the authenticated user?

log.description: A log of status changes for this flow

TransferStatusLog.description: Details of a change that took place in a transfer status.

by.description: The user that performed the change

date.description: The date / time the action was performed

comments.description: Comments provided by the user which performed the change

from.description: Reference to the source account type

to.description: Reference to the destination account type

TransferView.description: Details about a balance transfer between accounts

parent.description: Reference to the parent transfer that generated this one, if any

children.description: Reference to the transfers generated by this one, if any

chargedBackBy.description: Reference to the transfer that has charged back this transfer. Only returned if this transfer has been charged back.

chargebackOf.description: Reference to the transfer that this transfer has charged back. Only returned if this transfer is a chargeback.

transaction.description: If this balance transfer was originated from a transaction (like a payment or scheduled payment), contains the reference to this transaction. Only returned if this `TransferView` is not already in a `TransactionView`.

statusFlows.description: List with each status this transfer has, with additional information, such as the flow and the log

canChargeback.description: Can the authenticated user chargeback this transfer?

operations.description: The list of custom operations the logged user can run over this transfer

confirmationPasswordInput.description: If a confirmation password is used, contains the definitions on how to request that password from the user. This confirmation password is required when performing sensible actions. Sometimes this is dynamic, for example, the confirmation might be configured to be used only once per session, or operations like payments may have a limit per day to be without confirmation (pinless).

UIElementWithContent.description: Contains definitions for a UI element that has a content

UnansweredAdQuestionResult.description: An unanswered question for an advertisement.

UnauthorizedError.description: Error returned when a HTTP status code 401 occurs

missingSecondaryPassword.description: May only returned when `code` is `login` and there is a login confirmation with password defined for the channel.

secondaryDeviceAllowed.description: Whether confirmations with device are allowed or not.   May only returned when `code` is `login` and there is a login confirmation defined for the channel.

User.description: Basic representation of a user (both admin and regular)

display.description: Contains the formatting of the user according to the configuration. Is only returned if no profile fields are marked to return in user list.

shortDisplay.description: Contains the short formatting of the user according to the configuration. Is only returned if no profile fields are marked to return in user list

user.description: Is the operator owner, only returned if this user represents an operator. Even so, in some cases, like searching for operators of a specific user, this field may not be returned.

UserAccountBalanceLimitsListData.description: Data regarding the lower and upper limits of a user's accounts.

accountLimits.description: The balance limits for each account

UserAddressesListData.description: Contains, besides the user's addresses, additional data for its management

canManage.description: Indicates whether the addresses can be managed by the authenticated user

canCreate.description: Indicates whether the authenticated user can create a new address for this user

maxAddresses.description: Indicates the maximum number of addresses the user can have

UserAdsDataForSearch.description: Data for a search of advertisements of a specific user

createNew.description: Indicates whether the authenticated user can create new advertisements for this user

maxAds.description: The maximum number of advertisements this user can have

requiresAuthorization.description: Does advertisements of this user requires authorization to be published for other users to see?

query.description: Default query filters to search advertisements of a specific user

UserAdsQueryFilters.description: Definitions for search filters of advertisements of a given owner search

UserAlert.description: An alert for a specific user

UserAlertDataForSearch.description: Contains data for searching user alerts

groups.description: The groups the authenticated user can use to filter users.

UserAlertQueryFilters.description: Query filters for searching user alerts

datePeriod.description: The minimum / maximum alert date. Is expressed an array, with the lower bound as first element, and the upper bound as second element. When only one element, will have just the lower bound. To specify only the upper bound, prefix the value with a comma.

types.description: The types of user alerts to search

groups.description: Either the ids or internal names of the alert user

brokers.description: Either the ids or identification methods the alert user's brokers

user.description: Either the id or identifier of the alert user

UserAuth.description: Contains information returned after logging in an user.

UserBalanceLimitsPermissions.description: Permissions regarding the account balance limits of a given user

view.description: Can the authenticated user view the balance limits of the user?

UserBasicData.description: Contains properties shared by both UserDataForNew and UserDataForEdit

emailRequired.description: Indicates whether the e-mail is required

profileFieldActions.description: An object, keyed by profile field internal name (either one of the basic profile fields or custom fields), containing other objects that defines the allowed actions over these profile fields

UserBrokeringPermissions.description: Permissions regarding the user's brokers and brokered users

viewBrokers.description: Can the authenticated user view the brokers of this user?

viewMembers.description: Can the authenticated user view the assigned members of this broker?

UserBrokersData.description: Contains the current user brokers, as well as other information

brokers.description: Brokers currently assigned, together with additional information

editable.description: Can the authenticated user manage brokers of this user?

history.description: Contains the history entries for all brokering changes

UserClientTypePermissions.description: Contains details of an access client, together with permissions over it

canManage.description: Can the authenticated user manage access clients of this type?

canCreateNew.description: Can the authenticated user create a new access client of this type and user? Maybe the maximum allowed has been reached.

hasUnassigned.description: Is there at least one access client for this type and user which is in the unassigned status?

UserContactInfosListData.description: Contains, besides the user's additional contact informations, data for managing them

canManage.description: Indicates whether the additional contact informations can be managed by the authenticated user

canCreate.description: Indicates whether new additional contact informations can be created by the authenticated user

maxContactInfos.description: Indicates the maximum number of additional contact informations the user can have

customFields.description: The list of additional contact informations custom fields

add.description: Can the current user be added to the contact list?

remove.description: Can the current user be removed from the contact list?

hiddenByDefault.description: This flag determine whether this field is hidden or not by default

UserCustomFieldValue.description: Contains the custom field value information, plus the hidden flag

hidden.description: Whether this field is hidden for other users

UserDataForEdit.description: Contains data used to edit a user profile

details.description: Additional details to the user being edited

user.description: The object that can be altered and posted back to save the user / operator

emailPendingValidation.description: The new e-mail address, which is still pending validation. Is only returned when e-mail validation is enabled for edit profile, and the user has changed the e-mail address.

binaryValues.description: Holds the current values for file / image custom fields as lists of `StoredFile`s / `Image`s.

confirmationPasswordInput.description: If a confirmation password is used, contains the definitions on how to request that password from the user. This confirmation password is required when performing sensible actions. Sometimes this is dynamic, for example, the confirmation might be configured to be used only once per session, or operations like payments may have a limit per day to be without confirmation (pinless).

UserDataForMap.description: Contains configuration data for the user directory (map)

mapDirectoryField.description: Internal name of the custom field currently set as primary search filter for the user directory (map) search. When not returned (null) it is assumed that keywords should be the primary filter.

defaultMapLocation.description: The default location for the map to be displayed

defaultMapZoomMobile.description: The default map zoom level for mobile applications

defaultMapZoomWeb.description: The default map zoom level for web applications

UserDataForNew.description: Contains data used to register a user

user.description: The object that can be altered and posted back to register the user

agreements.description: The agreements that needs to be accepted by the user to be able to register. Only returned for public registrations.

securityQuestions.description: If enabled in the server, are the possible security questions the user can use to set the answer.

nfcTokenTypes.description: The NFC token types the authenticated user can parsonalize tags for the user being registered

captchaType.description: The captcha provider used to requested a captcha for registration, or null if no captcha is needed.

UserDataForSearch.description: Contains data with the configuration for searching users

broker.description: When a `broker` parameter was set when getting the data, contains the details of the broker

fieldsInList.description: The internal names of either basic or custom profile fields that are configured to be shown on the list. This actually defines the fields that will be loaded on the result. It is possible that no fields are configured to be returned on list. In this case, the result objects will have the 'display' property loaded with what is configured to be the user formatting field(s).

groupsForRegistration.description: Possible groups an administrator or broker can use to register users

query.description: Default query filters to search users

statuses.description: The possible user statuses the authenticated user can use to filter the search. Only administrators or brokers over their members can filter by status (also depends on permissions)

UserDocumentsPermissions.description: Permissions regarding the documents of a given user

view.description: Can the authenticated user view the documents of this user?

count.description: The number of documents for this user

UserEdit.description: Contains data used to edit a user / operator profile fields. Operators are always "hidden", so the `hiddenFields` property don't apply to them.

version.description: The version stamp for the current object, used for optimistic locking. When saving, the same version as previously received needs to be passed back. If no one else has saved the object, the version will match and the object will be updated. However, if someone other has saved the object, the version will no longer match, and an error will be raised. This is used to prevent multiple users (or processes) from updating the same object and unwilingly overridding the property values, leading to data loss.

UserGroupPermissions.description: Permissions regarding the group membership of a given user

view.description: Can the authenticated user view the group membership of a given user?

UserLocale.description: Defines the user's language and region

code.description: Country code used to specify user's language

UserManage.description: Contains the fields for either creating or modifying a user

hiddenFields.description: An array with the internal names of either the basic or custom fields that should be hidden from other users. Currently the only basic profile field that can be hidden is email. Any other will be considered a custom field, and should be the same key as used in the 'customValues' property.

UserNew.description: Contains data used to register a user. All basic profile fields (full name, login name, e-mail, phones, addresses and image) can be enabled or disabled on Cyclos, via products. Also, the available custom fields and whether they can be hidden depend on the products the selected group has.

mobilePhones.description: Mobile phones to be registered together with the user

landLinePhones.description: Land-line phones to be registered together with the user

passwords.description: The initial passwords of the user

skipActivationEmail.description: When set to true, the activation e-mail is not sent to the registered user. Can only be used when an administrator / broker is registering a user, and ignored on public registrations (the e-mail is always sent on public registrations).

addresses.description: Addresses to be registered together with the user

contactInfos.description: Additional contacts to be registered together with the user

images.description: The ids of previously uploaded user temporary images to be initially used as profile images

captcha.description: The captcha response is required on public registrations, and ignored when administrators / brokers register another user.

acceptAgreement.description: When there are agreements that need to be accepted for registration, this property must be passed with the value true

asMember.description: Flag required only when the authenticated user is a broker, in that case we need to distingish between registering as member or broker. If true then the new user will be registered without a brokering relationship. Otherwise the authenticated user will be set as the broker of the new user.

securityQuestion.description: If the server is configured to use security question, is the `internalName` of the question present in the result of `data-for-new`, in the `securityQuestions` property. Is optional and only used in public registration.

securityAnswer.description: If a `securityQuestion` is informed, this is the answer. Required in this case. Only used in public registration.

nfcToken.description: If not null then the given NFC token parameters will be used to personalize a tag for the user.

UserOperatorGroupsListData.description: Contains, besides the user's operator groups, additional data for their management

canManage.description: Indicates whether the operator groups can be managed by the authenticated user

canCreate.description: Indicates whether the authenticated user can create a new operator groups for this user

canCreateNew.description: Indicates whether the authenticated user can create more operators for the specified user.

groups.description: The operator groups this user owns

fieldsInList.description: The internal names of either basic or custom profile fields that are configured to be shown on the list. This actually defines the fields that will be loaded on the result. It is possible that no fields are configured to be returned on list. In this case, the result objects will have the 'display' property loaded with what is configured to be the user formatting field(s).

basicFields.description: The basic profile fields in the result list

customFields.description: The custom profile fields in the result list

query.description: Default query filters to search a user's operators

UserOperatorsPermissions.description: Permissions regarding the user's operators and operator groups

viewOperators.description: Can the authenticated user view the operators of this user?

viewGroups.description: Can the authenticated user view the operator groups of this user?

UserOperatorsQueryFilters.description: Definitions for a user's operators search filters

ignoreProfileFieldsInList.description: When set to `true`, instead of returning users with corresponding profile fields set on list, will return them with `display` and `shortDisplay`.

operatorGroups.description: An array of operator group ids

UserOrderResult.description: Data of an order as returned on list associated to an user.

relatedUser.description: The other related user, i.e if we're listing the sales of a user then it represents the buyer. Otherwise (purchases) the seller.

UserPaymentPermissions.description: Permissions for payments regarding a user

asUserToSelf.description: Can the authenticated administrator or broker perform a payment in behalf of this user to another account belonging to the same user?

asUserToSystem.description: Can the authenticated administrator or broker perform a payment in behalf of this user to a system account?

asUserToUser.description: Can the authenticated administrator or broker perform a payment in behalf of this user to another user?

systemToUser.description: Can the authenticated administrator perform a payment from a system account to this user?

userToUser.description: Can the authenticated member perform a payment from an himself to this user?

UserPermissions.description: Determines permission the authenticated have over a specific user

accounts.description: Accounts which can be viewed by the authenticated user

records.description: Records types the authenticated user can view over the given user

operations.description: Custom operations the authenticated user can run over the given user

tokens.description: Tokens the authenticated user can view over the given user

personalizeNfcTokens.description: NFC tokens the authenticated user can personalize for the given user

UserPhonesListData.description: Contains information for a list of phones

canManage.description: Can the authenticated user manage phones of this user?

canCreateLandLine.description: Can the authenticated user create new land-line phones for this user?

canCreateMobile.description: Can the authenticated user create new mobile phones for this user?

smsEnabled.description: Indicates whether outbound SMS is enabled in Cyclos

canVerify.description: Can the authenticated user verify mobile phones of this user?

canEnableForSms.description: Can the authenticated user enable / disable mobile phones of this user to send / receive SMS?

maxMobilePhones.description: Indicates the maximum number of mobile phones this user can have. Is only returned when `canManage` is `true`.

maxLandLinePhones.description: Indicates the maximum number of land line (fixed) phones this user can have. Is only returned when `canManage` is `true`.

UserProductAssignmentData.description: Contains the current user individually assigned products, as well as other information

userProducts.description: Products currently assigned to this individual user

groupProducts.description: Products currently assigned to the user's group

groupSetProducts.description: Products currently assigned to the user's group set

assignable.description: If the authenticated user can assign more products to the user, this is the list of possible products to assign to the user.

unassignable.description: Either internal names or ids of currently assigned products that the logged user can unassign from the user.

history.description: Contains the history entries for all product assignment changes

canCreateAddress.description: Will be true if the authenticated user can manage addresses and the user for which we are viewing its profile has not reached the maximum allowed addresses. Only if `manageAddresses` is true.

canCreateLandLine.description: Will be true if the authenticated user can manage phones and the user for whom we are viewing its profile has not reached the maximum allowed landline phones. Only if `managePhones` is true.

canCreateMobile.description: Will be true if the authenticated user can manage phones and the user for whom we are viewing its profile has not reached the maximum allowed mobile phones. Only if `managePhones` is true.

canCreateImage.description: Will be true if the authenticated user can manage images and the user for whom we are viewing its profile has not reached the maximum allowed profile images. Only if `manageImages` is true.

canCreateContactInfo.description: Will be true if the authenticated user can manage additional contact informations and the user for whom we are viewing its profile has not reached the maximum allowed additional contact informations. Only if `manageContactInfos` is true.

maxAddresses.description: The maximum number of addresses the user can own. Only if `manageAddresses` is true

maxMobiles.description: The maximum number of mobile phones the user can own. Only if `managePhones` is true.

maxLandLines.description: The maximum number of land-line phones the user can own. Only if `managePhones` is true.

maxImages.description: The maximum number of profile images  the user can own. Only if `manageImages` is true.

maxContactInfos.description:
The maximum number of additional contacts the user can own.
 Only if `manageContactInfos` is true.

addressAvailability.description: The availability for addresses. Only if `manageAddresses` is true

mobileAvailability.description: The availability for mobile phones Only if `managePhones` is true

landLineAvailability.description: The availability for land-line phones Only if `managePhones` is true

profileImageAvailability.description: The availability for profile images Only if `manageImages` is true

contactInfoAvailability.description: The availability for additional contacts Only if `manageContactInfos` is true

ignoreProfileFieldsInList.description: When set to `true`, instead of returning users with corresponding profile fields set on list, will return them with `display` and `shortDisplay`.

excludeContacts.description: When set to `true` will not return any user that is already a contact of the currently authenticated user.

UserRegistrationPrincipal.description: Contains information about a principal (user identification) and the channels that can be accessed using it

channels.description: The channels that can be accessed using this principal

user.description: The user that has just been registered

generatedPasswords.description: The types of passwords that were generated

rootUrl.description: The root URL that can be used to access the web interface

principals.description: Contains information about each user principal (identification) and the channels that can be accessed using it

address.description: Address to be placed on map. Is only returned when the search result type is `map`.

distance.description: Only returned when there is a base location to calculate the distance from. The unit (kilometers or miles) depends on configuration.

customValues.description: Holds the values for custom fields, keyed by field internal name or id. The format of the value depends on the custom field type. Example: `{..., "customValues": {"gender": "male", "birthDate": "1980-10-27"}}`

phone.description: First phone number, used when phone is marked on products to be returned on user list

accountNumber.description: First account number, used when account number is marked on products to be returned on user list

group.description: The user group. Only returned when the `includeGroup` parameter is set to `true` and the current user can see other users' groups.

groupSet.description: The user group. Only returned when the `includeGroupSet` parameter is set to `true` and the current user can see other users' group set.

UserSessionPermissions.description: Permissions regarding the login session of a given user

disconnect.description: Can the authenticated admin disconnect this user?

UserStatusData.description: Contains the current user status, as well as other information

possibleNewStatuses.description: If the authenticated user can manage the given user's status, contains the list of statuses that can be assigned.

history.description: Contains the history entries for all status changes

UserStatusLog.description: Information regarding a specific status change

period.description: The begin and end date the for this status. The current status has no end date.

comment.description: Comments supplied by the manager that performed the status change

UserStatusPermissions.description: Permissions regarding the status of a given user

view.description: Can the authenticated user view the status and history of a given user?

UserView.description: Represents a user with all data for viewing the profile

enabledProfileFields.description: The internal names of profile fields enabled for this user. For example, the user might have no phones, but it might be because he is not allowed to have phones or because there are currently no phones. Same for addresses, images and optional profile fields.

customValues.description: The list of custom field values this user has

group.description: Reference to the user group. Is only returned if the authenticated user has permission to see groups

groupSet.description: Reference to the user group set. Is only returned if the authenticated user has permission to see group sets and the user group is in a group set

additionalImages.description: Holds the images other than the primary image, which is returned in the `image` field

contact.description: When this user is in the contact list of the currently logged user, returns data about the contact relation. When not returned, this user is no in the logged user's contact list.

registrationDate.description: The date the user was registered. Only returned if the logged user manages the given used.

activationDate.description: The date the user was made active the first time. Only returned if the logged user manages the given used.

online.description: Indicates whether the given user is logged-in to the system. Only returned if the logged user manages the given used.

lastLogin.description: The last time the user logged in, or null if never logged in. Only returned if the logged user manages the given used.

firstLogin.description: The first time the user logged in, or null if never logged in. Only returned if the logged user manages the given used.

permissions.description: Permissions the authenticated has over this user

UserVouchersDataForSearch.description: Contains configuration data for searching vouchers of a user

mask.description: The input mask for voucher tokens. Optional.

types.description: The voucher types that can be used for searching

UserVouchersQueryFilters.description: Definitions for searching vouchers of a user

creationPeriod.description: The minimum / maximum voucher creation date. Is expressed an array, with the lower bound as first element, and the upper bound as second element. When only one element, will have just the lower bound. To specify only the upper bound, prefix the value with a comma.

expirationPeriod.description: The minimum / maximum voucher expiration date. Is expressed an array, with the lower bound as first element, and the upper bound as second element. When only one element, will have just the lower bound. To specify only the upper bound, prefix the value with a comma.

redeemPeriod.description: The minimum / maximum voucher redeem date. Is expressed an array, with the lower bound as first element, and the upper bound as second element. When only one element, will have just the lower bound. To specify only the upper bound, prefix the value with a comma.

token.description: The voucher token (with or without mask)

types.description: The ids or internal names of voucher types

UserWithBalanceResult.description: Result of a user search with balance

negativeSince.description: The date since the account has been negative

viewProfile.description: General permission to view the profile of other users. A fine-grained permission over specific groups can be configured. When attempting to view the profile of a user without permission, only very basic information is returned instead.

map.description: Permission to view the user map directory

registerAsAdmin.description: Is the authenticated user an administrator that can register users?

registerAsBroker.description: Is the authenticated user a broker that can register users?

registerAsMember.description: Is the authenticated user a user that can register other users?

UsersWithBalanceQueryFilters.description: Parameters for searching users with their balances

balanceRange.description: The minimum and / or maximum balance for users to be returned. Is expressed an array, with the lower bound as first element, and the upper bound as second element. When only one element, will have just the lower bound. To specify only the upper bound, prefix the value with a comma.

lastIncomingTransferPeriod.description: The minimum / maximum date of the last incoming transfer for users to be returned. Is expressed an array, with the lower bound as first element, and the upper bound as second element. When only one element, will have just the lower bound. To specify only the upper bound, prefix the value with a comma.

lastOutgoingTransferPeriod.description: The minimum / maximum date of the last outgoing transfer for users to be returned. Is expressed an array, with the lower bound as first element, and the upper bound as second element. When only one element, will have just the lower bound. To specify only the upper bound, prefix the value with a comma.

negativeSincePeriod.description: The minimum / maximum negative-since date for users to be returned. Is expressed an array, with the lower bound as first element, and the upper bound as second element. When only one element, will have just the lower bound. To specify only the upper bound, prefix the value with a comma.

mediumBalanceRange.description: An array with 2 elements, describing the lower and upper medium balance bounds. If not specified, the range defined in the account type will be used. If that one is also not defined, there will be no definitions for balance levels. Both bounds need to be set as 2 element in the array, or it won't be considered.

UsersWithBalanceSummary.description: Contains summarized information about balances per range, plus the total

low.description: Summary of low balances. Is only returned when a medium balance range is defined, either in the account type or in the query parameters.

medium.description: Summary of medium balances. Is only returned when a medium balance range is defined, either in the account type or in the query parameters.

high.description: Summary of high balances. Is only returned when a medium balance range is defined, either in the account type or in the query parameters.

VersionedEntity.description: Basic definition of a persistent entity which has a version

version.description: The version stamp for the current object, used for optimistic locking. When saving, the same version as previously received needs to be passed back. If no one else has saved the object, the version will match and the object will be updated. However, if someone other has saved the object, the version will no longer match, and an error will be raised. This is used to prevent multiple users (or processes) from updating the same object and unwilingly overridding the property values, leading to data loss.

VersionedEntityReference.description: Represents an entity that is being referenced from another one, without caring about the type of the referenced entity. Also carries on the entity version

version.description: The version stamp for the current object, used for optimistic locking. When saving, the same version as previously received needs to be passed back. If no one else has saved the object, the version will match and the object will be updated. However, if someone other has saved the object, the version will no longer match, and an error will be raised. This is used to prevent multiple users (or processes) from updating the same object and unwilingly overridding the property values, leading to data loss.

Voucher.description: A voucher is a token which can be used to buy at places that accept payments in Cyclos. Even users which are not members can get a printed token (or scratch card, ticket, etc) and buy in such places.

VoucherBasicData.description: Contains common data for either buying or redeeming a voucher

customFields.description: The custom fields associated with this voucher type

confirmationPasswordInput.description: If a confirmation password is used, contains the definitions on how to request that password from the user. This confirmation password is required when performing sensible actions. Sometimes this is dynamic, for example, the confirmation might be configured to be used only once per session, or operations like payments may have a limit per day to be without confirmation (pinless).

vouchers.description: The identifiers of all bought vouchers.

voucherStatus.description: The status of all bought vouchers.

VoucherDataForBuy.description: Data used to buy a voucher

account.description: The account from which the buy will be debited

canBuyMultiple.description: If user can buy multiple vouchers at same time

fixedAmount.description: Returned if there is a fixed amount for bought vouchers. Is kept for backwards compatibility, because the `amountRange` is enough to return this information (when `min` and `max` are the same amount)

amountRange.description: Returned if there is a minimum / maximum amount for buying

minimumTimeToRedeem.description: Returned if there is a minimum time to be elapsed before bought vouchers can be redeemed

VoucherDataForRedeem.description: Data used to redeem a voucher

buyer.description: The voucher buyer, if any and visible

VoucherInitialDataForRedeem.description: Initial data used to redeem vouchers

buyer.description: The voucher buyer. Is not returned when the voucher was generated or when searching for bought vouchers of a user.

creationDate.description: The date a voucher was generated or bought

redeemer.description: The voucher redeemer. Is not returned when the voucher was not yet redeemed or when searching for redeemed vouchers of a user.

redeemDate.description: The date a voucher was redeemed (if so)

redeemAfterDate.description: The date after which the voucher can be redeemed. Is only returned if the voucher `status` is `open`.

redeemOnWeekDays.description: The days of the week a voucher can be redeemed. Is only returned if the voucher `status` is `open`.

VoucherTypeDetailed.description: Reference to a voucher type and add extra information.

title.description: The voucher title when it was created.

description.description: The voucher description when it was created.

buy.description: The transaction which bought this voucher, if any and visible.

redeemDate.description: The date the voucher was redeemer, if any.

redeem.description: The transaction which redeemed this voucher, if any and visible.

canCancel.description:
This is redundant with `cancelAction`, is `false` if `cancelAction` is `null`, and `true` if `cancelAction` is not `null`.


Can the authenticated user cancel this voucher?

showConfiguration.description: Should the voucher configuration be shown to users? This flag is `true` when there are multiple available configurations.

showQrCode.description: Should the voucher token be shown as QR-code for users?

redeemAfterDateReached.description: Should the voucher be available to be redeemed?

WebshopAd.description: An Ad with its status information.

allowDecimalQuantity.description: Indicates if the webshop ad allow enter a decimal value for the  quantity.

minAllowedInCart.description: The minimum quantity allowed to be added in the shopping cart.

maxAllowedInCart.description: The maximum quantity allowed to be added in the shopping cart.

stockQuantity.description: The stock disponibility. Only if `unlimitedStock` is false and the  'Stock type' was not marked as 'Not available' (through the web  interface).

unlimitedStock.description: If true then it means there is always disponibility of the webshop ad.

productNumber.description: The number assigned to the webshop ad.
